definition: persisting in evil brings about self-destruction (idiom)
pinyin: duo1 xing2 bu4 yi4 bi4 zi4 bi4

sentences.english: The only verdict is vengeance, a vendetta…
sentences.chinese: 对他们唯一的裁决就是复仇，多行不义必自毙。

sentences.english: One who committed many injustices is doomed to failure.

definition: appropriate retribution (idiom)
lit. heaven's net has wide meshes, but nothing escapes it (idiom, from Laozi 73)/fig. the way of Heaven is fair, but the guilty will not escape/you can't run from the long arm of the law
pinyin: tian1 wang3 hui1 hui1 , shu1 er2 bu4 lou4

definition: evil has its retribution (idiom); to suffer the consequences of one's bad deeds/sow the wind and reap the whirlwind (Hosea 8:7)
to eat one's own fruit (idiom); fig. suffering the consequences of one's own action/to reap what one has sown
If you don't want anyone to know, don't do it (idiom). fig. If you do something bad, people will inevitably hear about it.
pinyin: ruo4 yao4 ren2 bu4 zhi1 , chu2 fei1 ji3 mo4 wei2
related.word: 若要人不知，除非己莫为

definition: retribution/judgment
lit. to eat one's own bitter fruit (idiom)/fig. to suffer the consequences of one's own actions/to stew in one's own juice
lit. strung through and filled with evil (idiom); filled with extreme evil/replete with vice/guilty of monstrous crimes
virtue has its reward, evil its retribution
pinyin: shan4 you3 shan4 bao4 , e4 you3 e4 bao4

definition: lit. heaven's net has wide meshes, but nothing escapes it (idiom, from Laozi 73)/fig. the way of Heaven is fair, but the guilty will not escape/you can't run from the long arm of the law
death cannot wipe out the crimes (idiom); dreadful crimes that rankled even after the perpetrator is dead
guilty and deserves to be punished (idiom); entirely appropriate chastisement/the punishment fits the crime
If you want to condemn sb, don't worry about the pretext (idiom, from Zuozhuan 左傳|左传); one can always trump up a charge against sb/Give a dog a bad name, then hang him.
pinyin: yu4 jia1 zhi1 zui4 , he2 huan4 wu2 ci2

definition: loose, but allows no escape (idiom, from Laozi 老子[Lao3 zi3]); the way of Heaven is fair, but the guilty will not escape
if you live a life of crime, sooner or later you'll pay for it
pinyin: chu1 lai2 hun4 chi2 zao3 yao4 huan2 de5

definition: a clever person may become the victim of his own ingenuity (idiom); cleverness may overreach itself/too smart for one's own good
pinyin: cong1 ming2 fan3 bei4 cong1 ming2 wu4
